generate-deployable.description: The Connection is an example of a _resource_ configuration item (CI), a piece of configuration that is deployed together with your application. This example models a connection to an external system (e.g. a database) and requires a username/password and minimum/maximum pool size. Applications refer to a particular connection via it's alias.

property.name: alias
property.description: The alias is the name that applications use to refer to this connection. Since it is part of the application code that uses the connection, it must be specified by the application developer and must be the same in each environment.

property.name: username
property.description: The username is used to log in to the external system associated with this connection. The username is part of the environment configuration and is specified by the system administrator.

property.name: password
property.description: The password is used to log in to the external system associated with this connection. The password is part of the environment configuration and is specified by the system administrator. The password is secret and should not be exposed.

property.name: minPoolSize
property.description: The minimum pool size for the connection. It can be specified by either the application developer or the system administrator. If there is a company-wide default, the property can be set to this default and hidden so it can not be overridden.

property.name: maxPoolSize
property.description: The maximum pool size for the connection. It can be specified by either the application developer or the system administrator. If there is a company-wide default, the property can be set to this default and hidden so it can not be overridden.

method.name: checkConnection
method.description: Executes a check on the connection to validate that all of it's settings are correct.

generate-deployable.description: The Binary is an example of an _artifact_ configuration item (CI), a file or archive that makes up your application. Other examples of artifacts are application binaries, webcontent (HTML files, images, etc.) or database scripts. This example models an application binary and requires a reference to an external location on the file system (e.g. to serve images or other assets). Because the location on the filesystem varies per environment, it is included in the binary as a placeholder (REPOSITORY_LOCATION).

type.description: The AppServer is an example of a _container_ configuration item (CI), a target to which other CIs can be deployed. Examples of containers are application servers (for example Tomcat or JBoss in the Java space, IIS or Biztalk in the Microsoft space), database servers or web servers. This example models an application server to which artifacts and resources can be deployed and requires a home directory and port specifying where the application server is installed and how it can be reached.

property.name: home
property.description: The home directory for the app server, specified by the system administrator.

property.name: port
property.description: The port for the server, specified by the system administrator.

method.name: start
method.description: This control task starts the server.

method.name: stop
method.description: This control task stops the server.
